question: A ______ expense is one that stays the same every month, such as your monthly rent payment.
According to the 50/30/20 budgeting rule, 20% of your income should go toward ______ and debt repayment.
An ______ fund is money set aside to cover unexpected expenses like medical bills or job loss.
The process where the interest you earn also begins to earn interest is called ______.
A ______ account is mainly for daily transactions, while a savings account is meant for storing and growing funds.
FDIC insurance protects ______ in U.S. banks up to a certain limit, not investments in stocks or bonds.
Your ______ history has the greatest influence on your FICO credit score.
The Credit Utilization Ratio is calculated as total ______ used divided by total available credit.
A loan with an interest rate that stays the same throughout its term is said to have a ______ rate.
The ______ Method involves paying off the debt with the highest interest rate first.
Holding a mix of stocks, bonds, and real estate demonstrates the principle of ______.
In investing, ______ measures a stock’s price sensitivity relative to the overall market.
An employer’s contribution to an employee’s 401(k) plan, conditional on the employee contributing, is called a ______ contribution.
Contributions to a ______ IRA are made with after-tax dollars, and qualified withdrawals in retirement are tax-free.
A tax ______ reduces your taxable income, while a tax ______ directly reduces your total tax owed.
If you are in the 24% marginal tax bracket, only ______ of your total taxable income is taxed at 24%.
The amount you pay out of pocket before your insurance coverage starts is called a ______.
______ Life Insurance covers you for a specific term and typically does not build cash value.
______ is a type of scam where fraudulent emails trick people into revealing personal information.
A ______ Scheme pays returns to old investors using funds from new investors instead of actual profits.
